duties_responsibilities.duty: Assist individuals with personal care activities, nutritional needs, and restorative function such as bathing, dressing, toileting, and feeding.
Provide assistance with ambulation, transfers, positioning, and medical monitoring for individuals under care.
Complete progress notes, documentation, and reporting as assigned, ensuring clinical standards are met.
Maintain a clean and safe living environment for individuals, actively engaging in safety routines and corrective actions.
Transport individuals and participate in planned recreational activities and leisure time engagements.
Attend and actively participate in unit-based meetings, in-services, and quality improvement activities as scheduled.

education_certification.credential: High School diploma or equivalent, Current CNA certificate, CPR and First Aid certification, 3 years driving experience in the United States, valid driver's license
